SEARCH
Package com.simcraft.entities

Class MobileEntity

java.lang.Object
com.simcraft.entities.Entity
com.simcraft.entities.MobileEntity
All Implemented Interfaces:
Renderable, Updateable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Ali, Enemy
public abstract class MobileEntity extends Entity
Represents a mobile entity in the game that can move around the game world. Extends the Entity class to add movement-related behavior.

  • Nested Class Summary

  • Field Details

    • velocityX

      protected double velocityX
      The horizontal velocity of the entity, in pixels per frame.

      Velocity represents the rate of change of the entity's position in the horizontal direction (x-axis) over time. It is a vector quantity that defines both the speed and the direction of movement:

      • A negative value indicates movement towards the left of the screen.
      • A positive value indicates movement towards the right of the screen.
      The magnitude of this value determines how fast the entity moves horizontally in each frame, while the sign (positive or negative) determines the direction of movement.

      The value of this variable is dynamically influenced by the entity’s speed and any external forces (e.g., player input, game mechanics).

    • velocityY

      protected double velocityY
      The vertical velocity of the entity, in pixels per frame.

      Similar to horizontal velocity, vertical velocity represents the rate of change of the entity's position in the vertical direction (y-axis) over time. This is a vector quantity that determines the direction and magnitude of vertical movement:

      • A negative value indicates movement upwards (toward the top of the screen).
      • A positive value indicates movement downwards (toward the bottom of the screen).
      The magnitude of the vertical velocity determines how fast the entity moves vertically in each frame, while the sign determines the direction.

      Just like horizontal velocity, vertical velocity is influenced by speed and external factors, such as gravity or player input.

    • speed

      protected double speed
      The overall movement speed of the entity, in pixels per frame.

      Speed is a scalar value that defines the rate at which the entity moves, but unlike velocity, it only specifies the magnitude of the movement, not the direction. It is a non-negative value that represents how many pixels the entity moves per frame, independent of direction. Speed is a key factor in controlling how quickly the entity responds to movement commands, and it affects both horizontal (x-axis) and vertical (y-axis) velocities.

      The entity's speed can be adjusted dynamically depending on various factors, such as player input (walking or sprinting), game mechanics (buffs, debuffs), or environmental factors (wind, gravity). This speed value is used to calculate both `velocityX` and `velocityY`, typically by multiplying the speed by a factor based on the desired direction of movement.

    • jumping

      protected boolean jumping
      Flag indicating if the entity is currently in a jumping state. Default is false.

    • currentX

      protected double currentX
      The actual (potentially sub-pixel) x-coordinate of the entity on the screen.

    • currentY

      protected double currentY
      The actual (potentially sub-pixel) y-coordinate of the entity on the screen.

    • sprite

      public BufferedImage sprite
      The current sprite image of the entity.

    • worldX

      protected double worldX
      The entity's x-coordinate in the game world.

    • worldY

      protected double worldY
      The entity's y-coordinate in the game world.

    • updateScreenPosition

      public void updateScreenPosition()
      Updates the entity's screen position based on its world coordinates and the game's current scroll offset.

    • move

      public void move()
      Updates the entity's position based on its current velocities and handles jumping mechanics if the entity is set to move horizontally only.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Compares this entity to another object for equality.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Entity
      Parameters:
      obj - The Object to compare with.
      Returns:
      true if the objects are equal, false otherwise. Considers the horizontal and vertical velocities in addition to the properties compared in the parent Entity class.
      See Also:
      • Entity.equals(Object)

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the state of the entity, including its position based on its velocity. Also calls the Entity.update() method for base entity updates.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Updateable
      Overrides:
